snippet: A State Supreme Court justice rejected claims that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had inappropriately fast-tracked the state’s gun law and that its restrictions violate the Second Amendment.
abstract: State Supreme Court Justice Thomas J McNamara dismisses challenge to New York's new gun law, known as 2013 SAFE ACT, which bans sale of many semiautomatic firearms and requires owners to register with authorities; rejects claims that Gov Andrew M Cuomo had inappropriately pushed through legislature and that its restrictions violate Second Amendment; lead plaintiff, Robert Schulz, says he plans to appeal ruling.
lead_paragraph: A State Supreme Court justice rejected claims that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had inappropriately fast-tracked the state’s gun law and that its restrictions violate the Second Amendment.

headline.main: Cuomo’s Passage of Gun Law Was Legitimate, Judge Rules
headline.print_headline: Cuomo’s Passage of Gun Law Was Legitimate, Judge Rules
